messages.content: You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
What is the current temperature and humidity in the Ecobee - 276 Kitchen?

The device Ecobee - 276 Kitchen has properties for Temperature and Humidity. The Temperature property ranges from -50 to 150 Fahrenheit with 0.5 step and 1 precision, and Humidity ranges from 0 to 100 percent relative humidity.

Since you asked for the current values, I will provide the property names and their values with units. However, the actual current values are not given in the structure, so I will respond with the property names and units as per the device structure.

Result:
- Temperature: Value in range -50 to 150 Fahrenheit (step 0.5)
- Humidity: Value in range 0 to 100 % Relative Humidity

If you want me to query the current values, please ask to perform a Query command.
You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
Set the heat setpoint to 75 degrees Fahrenheit on the Ecobee - 276 Kitchen.

To set the heat setpoint on the Ecobee - 276 Kitchen, the device accepts the command Heat Setpoint [CLISPH] with one parameter:
- Parameter 1: Heat Setpoint value
- Range: 32 to 90 Fahrenheit (step of 1, precision of 1)

You requested to set it to 75 degrees Fahrenheit, which is within the allowed range.

Command to send:
- Command Name: Heat Setpoint [CLISPH]
- Parameter 1: 75 Fahrenheit (within range 32 to 90)

This will adjust the heat setpoint to 75°F as requested.
You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
Change the mode of the Ecobee - 276 Kitchen to Auto.

The Ecobee - 276 Kitchen device accepts the command Mode [CLIMD] with one parameter:
- Parameter 1: Mode
- Allowed Enum values:
  Off [0], Heat [1], Cool [2], Auto [3], Aux/Emergency Heat [4], Resume [5], Fan Only [6], Furnace [7], Dry Air [8], Moist Air [9], Auto Changeover [10], Energy Save Heat [11], Energy Save Cool [12], Away [13], Program Auto [14], Program Heat [15], Program Cool [16]

You want to set the mode to Auto, which corresponds to enum value 3.

Command to send:
- Command Name: Mode [CLIMD]
- Parameter 1: Auto (3)

This will set the Ecobee - 276 Kitchen mode to Auto as requested.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Ecobee - 276 Kitchen
ID: n001_t416412733203
  ***Accept Commands***
    Fan Mode [CLIFS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Auto [0]
            On [1]
        Parameter 2: Hold Type [HoldType]
          Enum
            Running [0]
            Hold Next [1]
            Hold Indefinite [2]
USER QUERY:
Turn the fan mode to On indefinitely on the Ecobee - 276 Kitchen.

The Ecobee - 276 Kitchen supports the command Fan Mode [CLIFS] with two parameters:
- Parameter 1: Fan Mode, Enum values: Auto [0], On [1]
- Parameter 2: Hold Type, Enum values: Running [0], Hold Next [1], Hold Indefinite [2]

You want to set the fan mode to On indefinitely, which means:
- Parameter 1: On (1)
- Parameter 2: Hold Indefinite (2)

Command to send:
- Command Name: Fan Mode [CLIFS]
- Parameter 1: 1 (On)
- Parameter 2: 2 (Hold Indefinite)

This will turn the fan on and hold that state indefinitely as requested.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Ecobee - 276 Kitchen
ID: n001_t416412733203
  ***Accept Commands***
    Setpoint Up [BRT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 10 Unit Degrees (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Setpoint Down [DIM]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 10 Unit Degrees (step of 1 and precision of 1).
USER QUERY:
Increase the temperature setpoint by 3 degrees on the Ecobee - 276 Kitchen.

The Ecobee - 276 Kitchen device accepts the command Setpoint Up [BRT] to increase the temperature setpoint.

This command has one parameter:
- Parameter 1: Degrees to increase
- Range: 0 to 10 degrees (step of 1, precision of 1)

You want to increase the setpoint by 3 degrees, which is within the allowed range.

Command to send:
- Command Name: Setpoint Up [BRT]
- Parameter 1: 3 Degrees

This will increase the temperature setpoint by 3 degrees as requested.
